intro: Chartolepis cappadocica, commonly known as the Cappadocian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in dry, sunny conditions. It has hairy stems and oval, pointed leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
